context: Hank checks on availability for a Park City trip. Ryan manages shifting attendance, bed preferences, and social comfort by laying out options, expanding inventory, and delegating recruitment in a way that preserves goodwill.

text.msg: Is your Park city house full?

Spencer had to back out so I know there's at least a spot available
Can you come?
I want to go for sure. Looking for a spot. Was thinking to get a hotel. Who would I be rooming with?

Nobody has claimed actual bed spots yetâ€¦ but here are some possible options:

- open bunk or double bed in a big room with Alejandro, Perrin, Jesse Koehler, Jonathan Abernathy & hot frens
- Share a King/Queen with Resnicow
- Share a King w Thom & Danny
- Share a King w Dakota & myself

And we can check out the house and invite list tmrw if you want to look into other shuffle options
I wouldn't want to be in a big room. I'd be down to share with Jake but he said wants his own room

Hey, so based on everyone wanting to go, I'm going to grab this place that's right next to the current house: https://www.vrbo.com/4322697?chkin=2025-02-20&chkout=2025-02-24 ... would you still want your own room?

Right now, Jacque and his BF, Matt & Mark, and either us or Nick and Zane would be in the new place, with space for another 3-4 people. If you want you can help recruit the rest of the space ðŸ˜Š

internal.thought: I confirm availability and immediately check his intent so I don't reserve capacity unnecessarily.
I lay out all current options transparently so he can self-select instead of negotiating privately.
When preferences tighten, I expand inventory rather than forcing a bad fit. Offering recruitment gives him agency and distributes the coordination load.
